NoteLiteral.En:
For whom? 
This module is on a bachelor level.  

Admission requirements:
- You must upload an official English copy of your current transcript of records for your bachelor program. 
- You must upload a short motivation letter (maximum 500 words) 
- You must fill in all the fields in the personal information registration form linked under "application process". This information is required to complete the admission process at University of Stavanger. 
Admission process 

We process applications toward the end of the application period. If your application is accepted, you will receive an offer sent to your ECIU email address. 

Please remember to check your ECIU email and spam folder regularly and note that you have 7 days to accept the offer.

Description.En:
This challenge addresses an often-neglected dimension of diversity and inclusion which is ‘age’, particularly ‘minor age’. Adultcentric bias can create barriers in recognizing the capacities of children and youth to contribute to society as they can be pre-judged to be ‘incompetent’ or ‘not-yet developed’ due to their age. Raising critical self-awareness of adultcentrism among adults in educational contexts can support them to develop more age-inclusive attitudes towards children and youth in daily life. However, this process of raising critical self-awareness related to one’s own adult age can bring up emotional responses e.g., fear, guilt, insecurity, denial etc. that can create obstacles in the learning process of adults and might worsen intergenerational differences.

The central challenge in this course is to propose a game to be used by adults to raise the awareness of the psychological concept of ‘adultcentrism’ among adults in educational relationships with children and youth.

A key ethical question in developing a game for this purpose is whether the design of such a game is age-sensitive towards adult learners.

The participants work in a Challenge Based Learning framework to propose a game designed for raising critical self-awareness i.e., of adult-centric biases, among adults in educational relationships with children and youth. The activities include readings, podcasts, teamwork, lectures and workshops. Participants will work part-time, digitally, over a period of three months. There will also be the opportunity for a 5-day visit to the University of Stavanger, but this part can also be attended online.

NoteLiteral.En: The candidate has knowledge of critical developments in age-inclusive educational research and psychology.
The candidate has knowledge of the Challenge Based Learning (CBL) method.

PrefLabel.En: respect the diversity of cultural values and norms

NoteLiteral.En: The candidate can apply critical knowledge to promote more age-inclusive intergenerational relationships.
The candidate can apply the CBL method to propose a game to raise awareness of adult centrism.
The candidate has awareness of the ethical challenges related to raising critical self-awareness among adults in educational contexts with children and youth.
The candidate can apply the CBL method to finding multidisciplinary solutions.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**For whom?**

This module is on a bachelor level.  

**Format**

This module is a hybrid format. The lectures are online during stage 1 and 3. During stage 2, students can choose whether to attend online or in-person at the University of Stavanger campus. Participation in lectures, pitches, presentations and teamwork is mandatory.

**Schedule**  

Stage 1: Online

- Thursday 24th April: Kick-off and Introduction, 16:00–18:00 (2 hrs)

Stage 2: At the University of Stavanger/ Hybrid

- Thursday 8th May: Lecture Adultcentrism and CBL practical questions, 16:00-18:00 (2 hrs)
- 12th - 16th May (32 hrs in presence/online)

Ice breaking, lectures on CBL, Game-based learning and Adult-centric Psychology, teamwork, tasks and practical inputs.   

Stage 3: Online

- Wednesday 21st May: Lecture Critical thinking theory, and CBL practical questions, 16:00-18:00 (2 hrs)
- Thursday 22nd May: Orientation Lecture, 16:00-18:00 (2 hrs)
- Thursday 5th June: Online Teamwork, 16:00-18:00 (2 hrs)

Submissions and Final Assessment: Online

- Wednesday 18th June: 10 minutes Final Team Pitch for jury, 16:00-18:00 (2 hrs)
- Friday 20th June: Final Team and Individual Submissions, 14:00

**Funding to travel?**

Please contact your local/home university to check out the possibility to apply for funding for the travel and stay (mobility support). There might be an early deadline for this, so check this out as soon as you can.

**Housing and travel**

Due to the difficult housing situation in Stavanger, UiS cannot provide accommodation for short-term international students. Therefore, you will have to find housing on the private market. The host department at UiS will help provide some suggestions for how to find accommodation.

Please note that you are responsible for organizing your own travel.
Creating Awareness of Adultcentrism in Educational Relationships through Game-based Learning

Adultcentric bias can create barriers in recognizing the capacities of children and youth to contribute to society as they can be pre-judged to be ‘incompetent’ or ‘not-yet developed’ due to their age.

The central challenge in this course is to propose an age-sensitive game for adults to raise their awareness of adultcentrism in their educational relationships with children and youth.

**For whom?**

This module is on a bachelor level.

**Admission requirements**

- You must upload an official English copy of your current transcript of records for your bachelor program.

- You must upload a short motivation letter (maximum 500 words)

- You must fill in all the fields in this form: [personal information registration](https://forms.office.com/e/NWYzspN06j). This information is required to complete the admission process at University of Stavanger.

**Admission process**

We process applications toward the end of the application period. If your application is accepted, you will receive an offer sent to your ECIU email address.

Please remember to check your ECIU email and spam folder regularly and note that you have 7 days to accept the offer.
